In Mexico, Trump's new tariff threat no longer causes panic
description: The US president threatened to raise tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, its leading trading partner, to 30%. Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum responded pragmatically to the announcement, as the Trump administration had already made 12 tariff-related announcements directly or indirectly targeting Mexico since January.

headline: In Syria, 37 killed during clashes in predominantly Druze city
description: The clashes, which also left around 50 wounded, are the first outbreak of deadly violence in the area since dozens of people were killed in April and May.

headline: The dazzling legacy of iconoclastic jewelry designer Attilio Codognato
description: Known for his snake- and skull-shaped jewelry, the iconoclastic designer who died in 2023 also left behind an astonishing collection of works by Andy Warhol, Marcel Duchamp and Maurizio Cattelan, now fiercely protected by his children. His Venetian boutique, once a magnet for global celebrities, remains the only place in the world to find Codognato's singular creations.

headline: Bastille Day in 1945: Versailles, the city of the Sun King, swept up in republican jubilation
description: '1945, A French Summer' (1/6). On Saturday, July 14, 1945, Versailles was celebrating as it had not done in years. But the carefree spirit of some clashed with the return of deportees and the restrictions still in place.

headline: At Rencontres d'Arles, the artistic blur between AI and photographers remains unresolved
description: The issue of works being plundered to train generative artificial intelligence search engines remains unsettled. Negotiations between representatives of creators and generative AI systems to reach a licensing agreement appear to be stalling.
